Little Bob looked up and saw the grumpy old man from the house across the street. He was standing with his arms crossed. He scowled at Little Bob and yelled, "Stop pushing that cone!"

Tom and Anna liked to feed the ducks at the pond. Every Sunday, they went with Mom and Dad and brought some bread. They liked to see the ducks swim and quack and eat.
One Sunday, they saw a new duck. It was big and white and had a red thing on its head. It looked different from the other ducks. Tom and Anna wanted to feed it, but Mom said, "Be careful, that is a goose. It might bite you."
Tom and Anna did not listen. They threw some bread to the goose. The goose ate it and came closer.

Jack asked, "Why not?"
"It looks so pretty but it's no good," said the old man.
